hanzi-su-wiki:
途

Значения

Дорога, путь

Мнемоника

Излишек 余 движения 辶 для пешехода на дороге. Места всегда больше, чем ему требуется.

heisig_chinese_memo: Trucks have many routes and must check in at the scales before they can get on the road.
heisig_constituent: route, scales, too much, umbrella, potato, small, road
koohiiStory1: On this route, all trucks have to check in at the scales before they can get on the road.
koohiiStory2: There are too many roads, so you need to plan a route.
jp_example_words:
前途(ぜんと): future prospects, outlook, the journey ahead
途中(つちゅう): on the way, en route
途上(とじょう): en route, half way
途絶える(とだえる): to stop, to cease, to come to an end
中途(ちゅうと): in the middle, half-way
途端(とたん): just (now, at the moment, etc.)
用途(ようと): use, usefulness
途中(とちゅう): on the way
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: When you ride a scooter you'll have a surplus of possible routes. Not only can you drive on any road, but you can ride on the sidewalk too!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Okay, so it might not be legal to take the sidewalk route depending on where you live, but physically, you can do whatever you want because scooters are small.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You decide to take the fastest route, since you have so many options, and drive on the sidewalk. However, in doing so you run over every single toe (と) on every single person trying to walk there.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Psh, whatever. They aren't your toes, and this is the fastet route! You'll name it the toe route and do whatever you want.
Ru_Radicals: 亅 (зазубрина), 个 (китайский счётный суффикс), ハ, 込 (внутрь), 木 (дерево)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: surplus (余) moving (⻌) happens on the road
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Trucks have many routes and must check in at the scales before they can get on the road.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The inscriptions from "辵", " Yu " sound, "辵" from "彳" from " stop ", "彳" is like a road, and " stop " is like a person's foot. The original meaning is road, road.

" Tu " means that the road is seen in ancient books, "Guan Zi. "Zhong Kuang": "Uncle Bao and Xi Peng rushed out, and Guan Zhong Yu Tu said: "Gong is angry." It means that Uncle Bao and Xi Peng rushed out, chased Guan Zhong on the road, and told him that Huan Gong was angry. Later, " tu " was used as a metaphor for official career, approach, method, system, category, etc.

Bronze writing is used as a person's name. The grandson of Chu Hang (Uncle) Tulu: "The grandson of Chu Hang (Uncle) is the 盉." The "盉" is a vessel used to pour clean water to wash your hands. The water after washing your hands is placed in a tray. Therefore, "盉" and " pan " are often used together. The inscription says that the grandson of Uncle Chu casts this 盉.
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The inscriptions from "辵", " Yu " sound, "辵" from "彳" from " stop ", "彳" is like a road, and " stop " is like a person's foot. The original meaning is road, road.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「辵」，「余」聲，「辵」從「彳」從「止」，「彳」象道路，「止」象人的腳，本義是道途，路途。

　　「途」表示路途見於古書，《管子．中匡》：「鮑叔、隰朋趨而出，及管仲於途曰：『公怒。』」意謂鮑叔、隰朋趕着出來，在路上追到管仲，跟他說桓公發怒了。後來「途」用來比喻仕途、途徑、方法、體系、門類等。

　　金文用作人名。楚弔之孫途盉：「楚弔(叔)之孫途為之盉。」「盉」是用作傾注清水來洗手的器皿，洗完手的水盛在盤中。故「盉」、「盤」常常配合使用。銘文說楚叔的孫子途鑄造此盉。
humanum_short_description: 金文從「辵」，「余」聲，「辵」從「彳」從「止」，「彳」象道路，「止」象人的腳，本義是道途，路途。

金文從「 辵 」，「 余 」聲，「 辵 」從「 彳 」從「 止 」，「 彳 」象道路，「 止 」象人的腳，本義是道途，路途。 「 途 」表示路途見於古書，《管子．中匡》：「鮑叔、隰朋趨而出，及管仲於途曰：『公怒。』」意謂鮑叔、隰朋趕着出來，在路上追到管仲，跟他說桓公發怒了。後來「 途 」用來比喻仕途、途徑、方法、體系、門類等。 金文用作人名。楚弔之孫途盉：「楚弔(叔)之孫途為之盉。」「 盉 」是用作傾注清水來洗手的器皿，洗完手的水盛在盤中。故「 盉 」、「 盤 」常常配合使用。銘文說楚叔的孫子途鑄造此盉。
Elaboration: The inscriptions from " 辵", " Yu" sound, " 辵" from " 彳" from " stop", " 彳" is like a road, and " stop" is like a person's foot. The original meaning is road, road. " Tu" means that the road is seen in ancient books, "Guan Zi. "Zhong Kuang": "Uncle Bao and Xi Peng rushed out, and Guan Zhong Yu Tu said: "Gong is angry." It means that Uncle Bao and Xi Peng rushed out, chased Guan Zhong on the road, and told him that Huan Gong was angry. Later, " tu" was used as a metaphor for official career, approach, method, system, category, etc. Bronze writing is used as a person's name. The grandson of Chu Hang (Uncle) Tulu: "The grandson of Chu Hang (Uncle) is the 盉." The " 盉" is a vessel used to pour clean water to wash your hands. The water after washing your hands is placed in a tray. Therefore, " 盉" and " pan" are often used together. The inscription says that the grandson of Uncle Chu casts this 盉.

途字的基本解释

途
tú
道路：路途。途径。旅途。长途。坦途。日暮途穷。前途。
道路

途字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tú］
［《廣韻》同都切，平模，定。］
(1)道路。
(2)途径；路子。多用于比喻。
(3)仕途，官吏晋升之路。
(4)体系；门类。
(5)追击，镇压。参见“途衆”。

途字的英文翻译

◎ 途
road, route, way

途字的康熙字典解释

【酉集下】【辵字部】　途； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1257第20
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?同都切，音徒。【玉篇】路也。【廣韻】道也。　又通作涂、塗。【周禮·冬官考工記·匠人】經涂九軌。【論語】遇諸塗。　又叶徒故切，音度。【張衡·思?賦】雲師?以交集兮，凍雨沛其灑途。轙琱輿而樹葩兮，擾應龍以服輅。

途字的源字形

途字的起名意思

：本义指道路，也可以译为路途、旅途、前途。

Пиктофонетические символы.
Это (юань) выражает значение, надпись печати похожа на дорогу и ногу, нарисованная (нарисованная как), чтобы сохранить звук, нарисованная грязью, это означает, что дорога грязная и пыльная.
Первоначальное значение - это дорога, по которой люди должны идти.

Radicals: 余  (surplus, scooter)
Meaning Mnemonic
When you ride a scooter you'll have a surplus of possible routes. Not only can you drive on any road, but you can ride on the sidewalk too!
Okay, so it might not be legal to take the sidewalk route depending on where you live, but physically, you can do whatever you want because scooters are small.
Reading Mnemonic
You decide to take the fastest route, since you have so many options, and drive on the sidewalk. However, in doing so you run over every single toe (と) on every single person trying to walk there.
Psh, whatever. They aren't your toes, and this is the fastet route! You'll name it the toe route and do whatever you want.
